properties.question: Where is the main shrine (Mukhya Dham) of Baba Ramdev Ji located?
properties.brief: One of the 'Panch-Peers'; famous for the Bhadrapada Mela and the Kamadiya Panth.

properties.question: When did Baba Ramdev Ji take 'Jeevit Samadhi'?
properties.brief: Known as the 'Peeron ke Peer' (Ramshah Peer) by Muslims.

properties.question: Where is the birthplace of the 'Deity of Snakes', Tejaji?
properties.brief: A non-Peer deity immensely popular among the Jat community; died protecting cows.

properties.question: When is the major animal fair of Tejaji held in Parbatsar?
properties.brief: Teja Dashami is celebrated across Rajasthan to honor his sacrifice.

properties.question: Where is the main site of Gogaji, known as Dhurmadi?
properties.brief: A 'Panch-Peer' who fought against Mahmud Ghazni to protect his cattle.

properties.question: When did Gogaji fight the historic battle against Mahmud Ghazni?
properties.brief: Ghazni called him 'Jahar Peer' (The Living God) due to his battlefield prowess.

properties.question: Where is the primary shrine of Devnarayan Ji, the deity of the Gujjar community?
properties.brief: An incarnation of Vishnu; his 'Phad' is the longest and oldest in Rajasthan.

properties.question: When was a postage stamp issued on the Phad of Devnarayan Ji?
properties.brief: He is traditionally worshipped with Neem leaves and bricks.

properties.question: Where is the shrine of Mallinath Ji, the protector of the Barmer region?
properties.brief: A major cattle fair is held here on the banks of the Luni River.

properties.question: When was the Mallinath Cattle Fair officially started by the Marwar state?
properties.brief: One of the oldest organized cattle fairs in India.

properties.question: Where is the birthplace of Pabuji Rathore, the 'Deity of Camels'?
properties.brief: A 'Panch-Peer' credited with bringing camels (Sandry) to Rajasthan.

properties.question: When is the Pabuji Phad typically recited by the Bhopa community?
properties.brief: Recited using the Ravanhatta instrument to cure ailing camels.

properties.question: Where is the shrine of Harbhu Ji, the master of Omens (Shakun Shastra)?
properties.brief: A 'Panch-Peer' and cousin of Baba Ramdev; he blessed Rao Jodha to reclaim Marwar.

properties.question: When did Harbhu Ji offer a 'Moong' blessing to Rao Jodha?
properties.brief: His cart (Gada) is worshipped instead of an idol in the Bengti temple.

properties.question: Where is the temple of Karni Mata, the 'Deity of Rats'?
properties.brief: She is the Kul-Devi of the Rathores of Bikaner; white rats are called 'Kaba'.

properties.question: When did Karni Mata lay the foundation stone of Mehrangarh Fort?
properties.brief: She is considered an incarnation of Hinglaj Mata.
